body_html:
Ah, that is because there is some missing data dependency in the BUILD rule (bazel aims for hermetic builds, so all the data and code dependencies need to be specified).

I would suggest that we do away with the data file dependency altogether and instead embed that copyright notice as a string constant in the generator. That way the java_gen_op_tool binary is a standalone binary and you don't have to worry about access to the data file every time it is invoked.
body_text:
Ah, that is because there is some missing data dependency in the BUILD rule (bazel aims for hermetic builds, so all the data and code dependencies need to be specified).
I would suggest that we do away with the data file dependency altogether and instead embed that copyright notice as a string constant in the generator. That way the java_gen_op_tool binary is a standalone binary and you don't have to worry about access to the data file every time it is invoked.
body:
Ah, that is because there is some missing data dependency in the BUILD rule (`bazel` aims for hermetic builds, so all the data and code dependencies need to be specified).

I would suggest that we do away with the data file dependency altogether and instead embed that copyright notice as a string constant in the generator. That way the `java_gen_op_tool` binary is a standalone binary and you don't have to worry about access to the data file every time it is invoked.
